Package Controller

Class AddUpdateCustomerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller.AddUpdateCustomerController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AddUpdateCustomerController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller for the addUpdateCustomerView.

    Adds or updates the customer records on the database.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    David Vaca

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        Different methods which create listeners are called.

        The ResourceBundle is assigned to the cusBundle parameter which is used to localized the errors displayed.

        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - Location for the root object.
        resources - ResourceBundle provided on the MainScreenController class, used for localization of the GUI interface.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        validateInput(), checkFields(), populateCountriesComboBox(), populateDivisionsComboBox()

      • setCustomer

        public void setCustomer​(Customer customer)
        Sets the selected customer and the update value to true.

        If a customer record needs to be updated, this method is called in order to set the update value to true, and all the TextFields and ComboBoxes are set to the customer parameters values.

        Parameters:
        customer - Selected customer from the customers table on the main screen view.
        Since:
        1.0

      • loadingView

        private void loadingView​(boolean state)
        Prevents the user from trying to summit multiple login attempts by disabling the GUI interface and showing a loading animation until the processes sent to the database are done processing.
        Parameters:
        state - A boolean that sets the anchorPane and loadingAnimation.
        Since:
        1.0

      • validateInput

        private void validateInput()
        Prevents the user from inputting correct information in the postalCodeTextField and phoneTextField.

        Any character not allowed will be automatically deleted.

        Since:
        1.0

      • checkFields

        private void checkFields()
        Binds the saveButton to the all of the TextFields. Therefore preventing the program from throwing an exception if ether TextField is empty and the saveButton is pressed.
        Since:
        1.0

      • populateCountriesComboBox

        private void populateCountriesComboBox()
        Queries a list of available countries from the database and assigns the values to the countriesComboBox.

        The loadingView(boolean) is set to true to prevent user errors.
        If the update value is true, here all applicable the parameters from the customer will be set.
        A Runnable method is used in order to prevent the Application thread from freezing due to the time it takes to retrieve the information from the database.
        The Platform.runLater() lets the app finish the runnable task and then calls an action to be perform on the javafx thread. Therefore preventing a exception for trying to call javafx methods in a different thread.
        A lambda expression is used to make easier use of the Runnable and the Platform.runLater.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        loadingView(boolean)

      • populateDivisionsComboBox

        private void populateDivisionsComboBox()
        Queries a list of available divisions from the database base on the selected country from the countriesComboBox and assigns the values to the countriesComboBox.

        The loadingView(boolean) is set to true to prevent user errors.
        If the update value is true, here all applicable the parameters from the customer will be set.
        A Runnable method is used in order to prevent the Application thread from freezing due to the time it takes to retrieve the information from the database.
        The Platform.runLater() lets the app finish the runnable task and then calls an action to be perform on the javafx thread. Therefore preventing a exception for trying to call javafx methods in a different thread.
        A lambda expression is used to make easier use of the Runnable and the Platform.runLater.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        loadingView(boolean)

      • onNameTextField

        public void onNameTextField()
        Passes the focus to the addressTextField.

        Called when the ENTER key is pressed while inputting the name on the nameTextField.

        Since:
        1.0

      • onAddressTextField

        public void onAddressTextField()
        Passes the focus to the postalCodeTextField.

        Called when the ENTER key is pressed while inputting the address on the addressTextField.

        Since:
        1.0

      • onPostalCodeTextField

        public void onPostalCodeTextField()
        Passes the focus to the phoneTextField.

        Called when the ENTER key is pressed while inputting the postal code on the postalCodeTextField.

        Since:
        1.0

      • onPhoneTextField

        public void onPhoneTextField()
        Passes the focus to the countriesComboBox.

        Called when the ENTER key is pressed while inputting the phone number on the phoneTextField.

        Since:
        1.0

      • onSaveButton

        public void onSaveButton()
        Gets all the values from the TextFields and ComboBoxes and inserts or updates a record on the database depending on the update value.

        The loadingView(boolean) is set to true to prevent user errors.
        A Runnable method is used in order to prevent the Application thread from freezing due to the time it takes to retrieve the information from the database.
        The Platform.runLater() lets the app finish the runnable task and then calls an action to be perform on the javafx thread. Therefore preventing a exception for trying to call javafx methods in a different thread.
        A lambda expression is used to make easier use of the Runnable and the Platform.runLater.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        loadingView(boolean)

      • onCancelButton

        public void onCancelButton()
        Called when the cancelButton is pressed.

        A confirmation alert is shown, if the result is OK the program will close; otherwise the window will stay opened.

        Since:
        1.0

      • onCloseButton

        public void onCloseButton​(javafx.stage.WindowEvent event)
        Called when the close button is pressed on the top of the window.

        A confirmation alert is shown, if the result is OK the program will close; otherwise the window will stay opened.

        Parameters:
        event - Closing window event.
        Since:
        1.0

      • phoneFormatter

        private java.lang.String phoneFormatter​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        Formats the phone numbers depending on the length of 10 or 12.
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - Phone number to be formatted.
        Returns:
        The formatted phone number.
        Since:
        1.0
